text: This is my first blog entry

ETH Z√ºrich, Prof.¬†Sereina Riniker (Apr.¬†2024 ‚Äì Dec.¬†2024)

Applied enhanced sampling molecular dynamics to study cyclic peptide permeability and structure-activity relationships.

Developed computational workflows integrating GROMACS, PLUMED, and RDKit for molecular simulations.

Conducted statistical physics-based analysis to interpret simulation outcomes.

Skills:


Molecular Dynamics (MD) Enhanced Sampling Techniques GROMACS PLUMED RDKit Computational Chemistry Statistical Physics





IBMB Barcelona, Dr.¬†Noelia Ferruz (Jun.¬†2023 ‚Äì Oct.¬†2023)

Trained and optimized large language models (LLMs) for predicting protein-small molecule interactions.

Implemented and fine-tuned transformer architectures (HuggingFace, PyTorch) on high-performance computing (HPC) clusters.

Presented research findings at the 2nd European Rosettacon, demonstrating practical applications of AI in protein engineering.

Skills:


Machine Learning (ML) Protein Language Models Transformer Models HuggingFace High-Performance Computing (HPC) Git & Version Control





EPFL Lausanne, Prof.¬†Bruno E. Correia (Oct.¬†2022 ‚Äì Feb.¬†2023)

Engineered AlphaFold-driven sequence designs for soluble analogs of membrane proteins.

Conducted medium-throughput protein expression and validated designs via X-ray crystallography and biophysical characterization.

Applied CD Spectroscopy and SEC-MALS to assess protein folding and oligomerization stability.


Structural Bioinformatics Computational Protein Design AlphaFold & Homology Modeling X-ray Crystallography CD Spectroscopy SEC-MALS Protein Expression & Purification





Max-Planck Institute, Prof.¬†Kai Johnsson (Nov.¬†2021 ‚Äì Jul.¬†2022, Mar.¬†2023 ‚Äì Jun.¬†2023)

Characterized and engineered rhodamine-binding proteins for advanced microscopy applications.
Developed a computational protein-engineering pipeline to optimize binding properties and stability.


Protein Expression Molecular Cloning Yeast Display ITC & FP Assays

title: Experiences
text:
ETH Z√ºrich, Prof.¬†Sereina Riniker (Apr.¬†2024 ‚Äì Dec.¬†2024)
Using enhanced sampling molecular dynamics methods to investigate cyclic peptides‚Äô structure-permeability and structure-activity relationship.
- Key Skills: Molecular Dynamics (MD), GROMACS, PLUMED, RDKit, Statistical Physics




IBMB Barcelona, Dr.¬†Noelia Ferruz (Jun.¬†2023 ‚Äì Oct.¬†2023)
Developed and evaluated large language models for small molecule-binding protein design; presented work at the 2nd European Rosettacon.
- Key Skills: Machine Learning, HuggingFace, PyTorch, Git, Protein Language Models




EPFL Lausanne, Prof.¬†Bruno E. Correia (Oct.¬†2022 ‚Äì Feb.¬†2023)
Worked on AlphaFold-based sequence design and experimental validation of soluble analogs for membrane proteins and homo-oligomerization.
- Key Skills: PyRosetta, X-ray Crystallography, CD Spectroscopy, Protein Design




Max-Planck Institute, Prof.¬†Kai Johnsson (Nov.¬†2021 ‚Äì Jul.¬†2022, Mar.¬†2023 ‚Äì Jun.¬†2023)
Characterized and engineered rhodamine-binding proteins for microscopy and developed a computational protein-engineering pipeline.
- Key Skills: Protein Expression, Molecular Cloning, ITC & FP Assays

Education

M.Sc. Biochemistry
University of Heidelberg (2021 ‚Äì 2024)
Specialization in Computational Biology, Protein Design & Machine Learning


B.Sc. Molecular Biotechnology
University of Heidelberg (2018 ‚Äì 2021)

Publications

title: Lars Dornfeld
text:
I‚Äôm Lars Dornfeld, a scientist interested in structural bioinformatics, protein design, and computational biology. I started in the wet lab, working on protein engineering and chemical biology, before transitioning to computational methods, focusing on machine learning for protein design and molecular dynamics to study cyclic peptides.
Feel free to explore my work ‚Äî thanks for stopping by!

  
    

    
  
    
     ü¶ã Bluesky
  
  
    
     Github
  

  
  
I am an incoming PhD student in the Biomolecular Design group at the Max Planck Institute for Biochemistry in Munich. My research will focus on enzyme design tools and applied projects, working at the interface of computational and experimental methods.
I‚Äôll be co-advised by Dr.¬†Lukas Milles and Prof.¬†Dr.¬†Karsten Borgwardt, combining expertise from both fields to develop innovative approaches in biomolecular design.
